alert.note: Alert for Harding; Perkins (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 2:53PM MST until February 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...WIDESPREAD HEAVY SNOW AND DANGEROUSLY COLD TEMPERATURES EXPECTED... .Arctic air will continue to slide south across the area late today and tonight. After snowfall across northern and western parts of the area today, snow will spread across the rest of the area tonight and especially on Wednesday. The combination of heavy snow and breezy winds will lead to difficult to nearly impossible travel conditions across northeastern Wyoming and much of South Dakota through early Thursday. The bitterly cold air will produce wind chills as low as 25 to 40 below zero across the area late tonight through late week. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Harding County and Perkins County. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
